warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead. Return to starting position.
Bring knees up towards chest, alternating legs.
Kick heels up towards glutes, alternating legs.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand holding onto a chair or wall for balance.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and back, then laterally. Repeat with other leg.
Twist torso from side to side, keeping legs stationary.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps, ensuring it rests comfortably across your back.  Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell across upper traps. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and bending your knees. Keep your chest up and core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Depth: Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below, maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your legs fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: 80-85% of your 1 Rep Max (1RM).  This means the heaviest weight you can lift for one repetition with good form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the hack squat machine to a comfortable height. Position yourself on the platform, ensuring your feet are firmly planted on the footrests.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart on the footrests. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Squat down by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and core engaged.
3. Depth: Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your legs fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable core and upright posture throughout the movement.  Avoid rounding your back.

exercises.setup: Adjust the hack squat machine to a comfortable height. Position yourself on the platform, ensuring your feet are firmly planted on the footrests.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart on the footrests. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Squat down by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and core engaged.
3. Depth: Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your legs fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Hold the barbell across your upper chest, either using a clean grip (palms facing upwards) or a cross-arm grip.  Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Hold the barbell across your upper chest, feet shoulder-width apart. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and bending your knees. Keep your chest up and core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Depth: Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below, maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your legs fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows up throughout the movement to maintain balance and proper form.

exercises.setup: Place one foot on a bench behind you, keeping your other foot flat on the floor in front of you.  Maintain a comfortable distance between your feet.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with one foot on a bench behind you, maintaining balance. Hold dumbbells at your sides (optional).
2. Descent: Lower your body by bending your front knee, keeping your torso upright and your back knee close to the ground.
3. Depth: Descend until your front thigh is parallel to the ground or slightly below.
4. Ascent: Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides (optional).
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides (optional).
2. Descent: Step forward with one leg, bending both knees to lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground.
3. Depth: Ensure your front knee stays behind your toes.
4. Ascent: Push off with your front foot to return to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining balance and control throughout the movement.  Use a lighter weight if needed to maintain good form.

exercises.setup: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs. Maintain a neutral spine.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell in front of thighs. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Hinge at your hips, pushing your hips back and keeping your back straight. Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping a slight bend in your knees.
3. Depth: Lower the barbell until you feel a good stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: 70-75% of your 1 Rep Max (1RM). This means the heaviest weight you can lift for one repetition with good form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs. Maintain a neutral spine.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell in front of thighs. Maintain a neutral spine.
2. Descent: Hinge at your hips, pushing your hips back and keeping your back straight. Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping your legs straight.
3. Depth: Lower the barbell until you feel a good stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips fully.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your back straight throughout the movement. Avoid rounding your back.

exercises.setup: Secure your ankles under the pads of a Glute Ham Raise (GHR) machine.  Adjust the machine to ensure your hips are slightly elevated.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Secure your ankles under the pads of a GHR machine.  Your hips should be slightly elevated.
2. Descent: Slowly lower your torso towards the ground by bending at your hips and knees.
3. Depth: Lower your torso until you feel a good stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Ascent: Drive through your heels and glutes to return to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: Bodyweight or added weight as needed to maintain good form and achieve 12 repetitions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Position yourself facing away from a sturdy bench or support, with your ankles secured under the support.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Position yourself facing away from a sturdy bench or support, with your ankles secured under the support.
2. Descent: Lower your body towards the ground by bending at your hips and knees.
3. Depth: Lower your torso until you feel a good stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Ascent: Use your hamstrings and glutes to push yourself back up to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Bodyweight or added weight as needed to maintain good form and achieve 12 repetitions.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlling the negative (lowering) portion of the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips. Your feet should be flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell across your hips. Feet should be flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Ascent: Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the ground, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
3. Depth: Raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
4. Descent: Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 15 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Perform this exercise similar to the barbell hip thrust, but with one leg extended in the air.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on your back with your upper back against a bench, one leg extended in the air, and a dumbbell or weight plate on your hips.
2. Ascent: Drive through your heel to lift your hips off the ground, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
3. Depth: Raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
4. Descent: Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 15 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a neutral pelvic position throughout the movement for optimal glute activation.

exercises.setup: Sit on a seated calf raise machine, placing your feet flat on the footrests. Adjust the machine to ensure your knees are slightly bent.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on a seated calf raise machine, placing your feet flat on the footrests. Adjust the machine to ensure your knees are slightly bent.
2. Ascent: Raise your heels off the footrests, extending your ankles fully.
3. Depth: Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calves at the top of the movement.
4. Descent: Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 15 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand on a slightly elevated surface, such as a weight plate, with your heels hanging off the edge.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand on a slightly elevated surface with your heels hanging off the edge.
2. Ascent: Raise up onto your toes, extending your ankles fully.
3. Depth: Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calves at the top of the movement.
4. Descent: Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire movement, avoiding any jerky motions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 15 repetitions with good form. Increase weight progressively each week.
exercises.additional_tips: Consider replacing with standing calf raises if soleus response is a concern.
